name: Mount Bond

trails_config.name: Lincoln Woods to Bondcliff Trail
trails_config.description: A remote journey deep into the Pemigewasset Wilderness. Hike via the Lincoln Woods and Bondcliff Trail, traversing Bondcliff and West Bond en route to Mount Bond’s summit. This extremely strenuous trek is often done as part of an overnight, but rewards hikers with unmatched solitude and sweeping views from the Bonds.

current_conditions.ai_summary: One of New Hampshire's premier peaks, Mount Bond rises to 4698 feet. It is known for its rugged terrain and panoramic vistas.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 4698 feet, Mount Bond is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its approachable and scenic terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Lincoln Woods to Bondcliff Trail**, a **20.0 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **NH48 4000-Footers**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **West Bond**, which is just 0.6 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
